Receipt of emails originating from exter.Data: Zeek dns.log; Zeek http.log; Windows Event ID 4688
Receipt of emails originating from exter.Action: Analyze Zeek dns.log, http.log, and Windows Event ID 4688 logs for activity originating from user systems (Endpoints) or servers (Servers) triggered by interaction with incoming emails from external sources. Correlate destination domains/IPs and process names against lists of known malicious indicators (Threat Intelligence). Use clustering or anomaly detection on connection patterns to identify unusual traffic volumes or destinations associated with email interaction (e.g., unexpected process creating outbound network connections after opening a document).

Unusual external-to-internal email traff.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for SMTP (port 25/587) connections from external IPs to internal mail servers or clients. Use time series analysis to identify unusual spikes in connection volume or connection attempts targeting specific internal users or groups, potentially indicating large-scale campaigns. Employ statistical methods (e.g., descriptive statistics, outlier detection using IQR) on source IPs, connection frequency, and target recipients to identify anomalous email traffic patterns potentially indicative of campaigns using compromised accounts.

Unusual outbound SMTP traffic originatin.Data: Zeek smtp.log; Windows Event ID 4688; Windows Event ID 5156
Unusual outbound SMTP traffic originatin.Action: Monitor Zeek smtp.log for outbound connections originating from internal source IPs not typically associated with sending external email. Correlate with Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) and 5156 (Network Connection) on endpoints to identify processes initiating these connections. Establish a baseline of normal outbound email sending hosts and volumes using frequency analysis and identify deviations or spikes. Investigate traffic spikes or sending from unapproved hosts, potentially indicating compromise or misuse of internal systems facilitated by compromised external accounts.

Attempted or successful logons to intern.Data: Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4625; Zeek conn.log
Attempted or successful logons to intern.Action: Monitor Windows Event IDs 4624 (Successful Logon) and 4625 (Failed Logon) on servers hosting internal services (OWA, VPN gateways, application servers) for logon attempts using usernames that match known or suspected compromised external email accounts (e.g., from threat intelligence feeds, previous incidents). Correlate with Zeek conn.log to identify source IPs and connection details. Use correlation analysis to link failed/successful attempts to specific usernames and source IPs over time. Alert on any internal logon attempts using usernames associated with known external compromises.
